text:
Is there an API reference somewhere for the Franklin.jl package itself? Or for commands usable in pages? Eg on <https://franklinjl.org/workflow/structure/|this page>, there's an example block with `{{ispage blog/*}} {{insert head_blog}}{{end}}`. `ispage` has some documentation <https://franklinjl.org/syntax/page-variables/index.html#conditional_blocks|here>, but I can't find where `insert` is documented. Similarly, things like `{{fill x}}` <https://franklinjl.org/syntax/page-variables/index.html#for_loops|here> aren't super clear, but I can't find other documentation.

Separately, I found the function in the <http://julialang.org|julialang.org> `utils.jl` file to generate blogposts, and they use the `pagevar` function, which <https://franklinjl.org/search/index.html?q=pagevar|I can't find> on the docs page, but which does have a docstring from the REPL

text:
Thanks, feel free to list these points in an issue, so we can chip at it gradually :slightly_smiling_face:

Just quickly in case this is blocking you now:
• `insert` inserts anything "as is" in HTML taking as base path the `_layout/` folder
• `fill` inserts the content of a page variable, shortcut `{{x}}` is the same as `{{fill x}}` if `x` is un-ambiguous (i.e. there is no `hfun_x` )
• `pagevar` is to get a page variable from a page that is different from the current one it works as `pagevar(rpath, name)` where `rpath` is the path of the other page like `blog/foo/bar.md` and `name` is the name of the page variable defined there that you'd want to include.
